required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Sort Out XI - Combo Stent Versus BioMatrix Alpha Stent
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Clinical Comparison of the Combined Sirolimus Eluting and Endothelial Progenitor Cell Combo™ Stent and the Biolimus Eluting Absorbable Polymer Coated BioMatrix Alpha™ Stent in Patients Treated With Percutaneous Coronary Intervention.

brief_summary.textblock: SORT OUT XI Comparison of Combo™ stent and BioMatrix Alpha™ stent in the treatment of unselected patients with ischemic heart disease.

detailed_description.textblock: Randomized clinical comparison of the Sirolimus eluting and endothelial progenitor cell Combo™ stent and the Biolimus eluting absorbable polymer coated BioMatrix Alpha™ stent in patients treated with percutaneous coronary intervention

primary_outcome.measure: Device-related Target Lesion Failure (TLF) The composite of cardiac death, target-vessel myocardial infarction (MI), or ischemia-driven target-lesion revascularization
primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint will be analyzed using the Kaplan-Meier method. Hazard ratios between groups will be calculated using a Cox proportional hazard model and the primary endpoint in the two per protocol treated groups will be compared with an upper one-sided 95% confidence interval. Patients treated with the ComboTM stent will be used as the reference group.

Repeat/new revascularization (PCI or CABG) within the stent or within a 5-mm border proximal or distal to the stent. (Angina, CCS > 1 related to the index lesion/vessel and diameter stenosis ≥ 50%. Diameter stenosis will be assessed by eyeballing, FFR <0.80, or iFR< 0.90). TLR will be clinically driven.

secondary_outcome.measure: Individual components of the primary end point comprise the secondary end points
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Clinical follow-up will be continued through 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: cardiac death; MI; clinically indicated TLR; all death (cardiac and noncardiac) and target vessel revascularisation (TVR); definite, probable, possible, and overall stent thrombosis according to the Academic Research Consortium definition (22); and a patient-related composite end point (all death, all MI (including procedure related MI), or any revascularization). For continuous variables, the difference between the treatment groups will be evaluated using Wilcoxon's rank-sum test. For discrete variables, the differences will be given as numbers and in percentages and will be analyzed using Fisher's exact test. Two-sided test will be used, and a pvalue of 0.05 considered significant.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with Cardiac Death
Number of participants with Myocardial Infarction
secondary_outcome.description: The acute MI diagnosis follows "The Joint ESC/ACCF/AHA/WHF Task Force on "Third Universal Definition of MI" (23), which has been adapted by Academy Research Consortium (22). In cases of updates of the definition of MI, the latest definition will be used.

secondary_outcome.measure: Target Lesion Revascularization due to clincal symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: Angina, CCS > 1 related to the index lesion/vessel and diameter stenosis ≥ 50%. Diameter stenosis will be assessed by eyeballing, FFR <0.80, or iFR< 0.90.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with all cause mortality
Target Vessel Revascularization due to clincal symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: Angina, CCS > 1 related to the index lesion/vessel and diameter stenosis ≥ 50%. Diameter stenosis will be assessed by eyeballing, FFR <0.80, or iFR< 0.90.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with stent thrombosis
secondary_outcome.description: Definite, probable, possible and overall according to the Academic Research Consortium definition (22)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with Patient-related composite end point
secondary_outcome.description: All death, all MI (including procedure related MI) or any revascularisation

intervention.description: Randomozation between either Sirolimus eluting and endothelial progenitor cell Combo™ stent or Biolimus eluting absorbable polymer coated BioMatrix Alpha™ stent
intervention.other_name: Biolimus eluting absorbable polymer coated BioMatrix Alpha™ stent

intervention.description: Randomozation between either Sirolimus eluting and endothelial progenitor cell Combo™ stent or Biolimus eluting absorbable polymer coated BioMatrix Alpha™ stent
intervention.other_name: Combined sirolimus eluting and endothelial progenitor cell Combo™ stent

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
All patients aged ≥18 years who are eligible for treatment with one or several drug-eluting coronary stents at one of the three heart centers in Aarhus, Odense and Aalborg can be included in the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age < 18 years
- The patient does not wish to participate
- The patient is not able to consent to randomization (eg. intubated patients)
- The patient do not speak Danish
- The patient is already included in the SORT OUT XI study
- Life expectancy <1 year
- Allergic to study related treatment
